channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Israel says it struck a Beirut suburb to hit a Hezbollah drone depot
item.description: The attack came as cross-border fire has escalated between Israel and militants in Lebanon, raising doubts about the state of a shaky ceasefire.
item.content:encoded:
The attack came as cross-border fire has escalated between Israel and militants in Lebanon, raising doubts about the state of a shaky ceasefire.

(Image credit: Hassan Ammar)
item.dc:creator: Alex Leff

item.title: The week's quiz has group chat drama. And don't worry, the answers aren't classified
item.description: This week's news coverage featured more Greenland drama than usual. And if you've been paying attention to it all, you'll get at least one question right.
item.content:encoded: This week's news coverage featured more Greenland drama than usual. And if you've been paying attention to it all, you'll get at least one question right.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: U.S. revokes hundreds of visas to repress student activism. And, HHS cuts jobs
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio says hundreds of visas have been revoked in an effort to repress student activism. And, the Trump administration plans to cut 20,000 jobs from health agencies.
item.content:encoded:
Secretary of State Marco Rubio says hundreds of visas have been revoked in an effort to repress student activism. And, the Trump administration plans to cut 20,000 jobs from health agencies.

(Image credit: EVELYN HOCKSTEIN)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Earthquake rocks Thailand and Myanmar, triggering the collapse of a Bangkok high-rise
item.description: The U.S. Geological Survey said the earthquake was a shallow 10 kilometers (6.2 miles), with an epicenter in Myanmar, according to preliminary reports.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. Geological Survey said the earthquake was a shallow 10 kilometers (6.2 miles), with an epicenter in Myanmar, according to preliminary reports.

(Image credit: Sakchai Lalit)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: As protections expire, Ukrainians who escaped war face an uncertain future
item.description: A U.S. immigration program allowed hundreds of thousands of Ukrainians to escape war. As Trump decides whether or not to renew it, recipients fear being deported.
item.content:encoded:
A U.S. immigration program allowed hundreds of thousands of Ukrainians to escape war. As Trump decides whether or not to renew it, recipients fear being deported.

(Image credit: Tim Evans)
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: Trump administration advances immigration crackdown on foreign student protesters
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said that his department has revoked the student visas of hundreds of students so far, with plans to cancel more.
item.content:encoded:
Secretary of State Marco Rubio said that his department has revoked the student visas of hundreds of students so far, with plans to cancel more.

(Image credit: EVELYN HOCKSTEIN)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Signal chat fallout, tariff tension — and 3 more takeaways from Trump's week
item.description: Here, five takeaways from a week when the Trump administration has had to deal with the Signal chat leak, announced new tariffs and made more deportations.
item.content:encoded:
Here, five takeaways from a week when the Trump administration has had to deal with the Signal chat leak, announced new tariffs and made more deportations.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: 10 road safety do's and don'ts that might just save your life
item.description: Motor vehicle crashes are a leading cause of death in the U.S. A highway patrol officer explains how drivers should handle emergency scenarios, from extreme weather to aggressive tailgaters.
item.content:encoded:
Motor vehicle crashes are a leading cause of death in the U.S. A highway patrol officer explains how drivers should handle emergency scenarios, from extreme weather to aggressive tailgaters. 

(Image credit: Klaus Kremmerz for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: U.S. sees large rise in border seizures of eggs, while fentanyl rate falls
item.description: President Trump cites risks from fentanyl to justify tariffs on Canada and Mexico. U.S. Customs and Border Protection says interceptions of eggs are way up, compared to 63 fentanyl cases last month.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump cites risks from fentanyl to justify tariffs on Canada and Mexico. U.S. Customs and Border Protection says interceptions of eggs are way up, compared to 63 fentanyl cases last month.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Cooper Flagg sends Duke into Elite Eight while Texas Tech wins an overtime thriller
item.description: The Sweet 16 weekend began Thursday night with dramatic late-night games as both men and women roll into action on Friday.
item.content:encoded:
The Sweet 16 weekend began Thursday night with dramatic late-night games as both men and women roll into action on Friday.

(Image credit: Patrick Smith)
item.dc:creator: Greg Echlin
